parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern. From poimen; to tend as a shepherd of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Made of iron. From sideros; made of iron.
A rod, staff, staff of authority, scepter. From the base of rhapizo; a stick or wand.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and the base of tribos; to crush completely, i.e. To shatter.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Of clay, made by a potter, earthen. From keramos; made of clay, i.e. Earthen.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
